meanings.definition: An injury to living tissue caused by a cut, blow, or other impact.
meanings.sent1: The deep wound on his arm required stitches.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the wound on her knee with antiseptic.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy licked the wound on his paw, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her words left a wound in his heart that took time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The wound from the accident left a scar as a reminder of the fall.

meanings.definition: A feeling of pain or distress caused by a past event.
meanings.sent1: The emotional wound from the breakup still hurt.
meanings.sent2: Time healed the wound of losing his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: His wounded pride made him refuse help, even though he needed it.
meanings.sent4: The wound of betrayal cut deeper than he expected.
meanings.sent5: The wound of rejection stung like a fresh cut.

meanings.definition: To inflict an injury on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally wound the rope around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The villain planned to wound the hero in their final battle.
meanings.sent3: She wound her brother by playfully teasing him about his haircut.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words wound her deeply, leaving emotional scars.
meanings.sent5: The hunter aimed carefully to wound the deer without causing unnecessary suffering.
